author: SteveL-MSFT
body:
PS-Committee decided we should be consistent with our naming and conform to Apple's use of macOS instead of OSX, however, for readability and consistently we are staying with Pascal casing.

Also renamed instances of variations of `OSX` to `macOS` for consistency in comments/text (separate commit to make it easier to review)

Fix https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/4700

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body: I don't see changes to `build.psm1`, is that file missed from this PR?

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @daxian-dbw ok, looks like VSCode cached exclusion list and I previously excluded build.psm1, will fix.  looks like .md files were excluded as well.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: [Apple Inc. ](https://www.apple.com/lae/macos/sierra/) uses `macOS` not `MacOS` - maybe we should use the same too? - `$IsmacOS`

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @iSazonov we had that discussion in the issue, the consensus is that $IsMacOS is preferred over $IsmacOS for readability and other languages (like Java) use isMacOS, so it's already somewhat common.

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: Should this run through the CI with [feature] to ensure none of the feature tests broke with the change?

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT

comments.author: dantraMSFT
comments.body: Yes, the failure is due to https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/pull/4763. You can ignore it.

title: Rename $IsOSX to $IsMacOS
